text: Hello there, I just want to set the HS cookie when the visitor submits the HS form without accepting the cookie banner. Since we are notifying the visitor that the privacy policy will be accepting while submitting the form. For other's, the flow will be same as default. Could someone please help me?

Just following up on my original post regarding integrating a file upload field with the HubSpot Contact API. After some testing, I've encountered that the HubSpot API doesn't natively support sending file data directly through form submissions.
Any tips or best practices would be greatly appreciated!

Thanks in advance!

Hey Guys,
Is there a way to register a domain in HubSpot without using a CNAME record? Currently when i add the cname record it effects the MX Records for the same subdomain
Or alternatively, does anyone know a workaround to have both a CNAME record and an MX record active for the same subdomain?
Hello - Is there way to grant a developer the ability to create a private app without granting them Super Admin

Hi all! I'm looking to hear what your recommended process for working in local development with multiple developers on one project is. Most of the time I'm unbothered, but we're having some issues with the use of sass compilers. If Dev A and Dev B are both working on css and its compiled into one common main.css file, they will overwrite each other with every save.
I've just set up git actions and i suppose that would solve the problem, but it also doesnt, because now my developers will have to push to a branch in order for it to compile and then view. It also wouldnt solve any potential issues working on the same file, though that's more unlikely for us.
Building on this, I've tried hs theme preview, but even with the domains its just white empty pages?
We usually work each on their own portal, then when a push is made on the main branch, an automatic deploy is done in the production account so there's no overwriting when working togheter
First you should save the file using the `files/v3/files` endpoint then handle the form submission with the file location instead?
Not completely sure what you’re doing here

Hey :wave:, just wondering if anyone else ran into the same issue I'm having with HubSpot content search. I have a dynamic page using the products object, I have an availability status field that has the options: (Available, Deposit, Draft, Sold, Unavailable). Using the previous field I can build a dynamic page for each product and display the content only if it has a status of Available or Deposit, if it doesn't it displays an error message and based on the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/beta-docs/guides/cms/content/content-search?uuid=5d9e5969-637e-44d1-849d-bd9e81bc61ec#how-can-i-exclude-pages-from-being-returned-in-search-results%3F|Content Search docs> I added a `<meta name="ROBOTS" content="NOINDEX, NOFOLLOW" />` to exclude the content from being found in search results. Yet content which has this meta tag is still shown within the search results. Any ideas?

:orange_heart:*Please take a moment to review our Code of Conduct*:orange_heart:

We want the HubSpot Developer community to be inclusive and welcoming. By following our Code of Conduct, you can help ensure that's the case.

TL;DR:
• Be respectful
• Be inclusive (try not to say, "Hey guys, hey boys, hey [any specific group]")
• No self promotion, except for <#C0121KGC6RM|showcase> and <#CBNDYJJAZ|jobs> 
• No unsolicited DMs
Read the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/slack/code-of-conduct|whole thing here> - and thanks for being a part of the HubSpot Developer Community!

Want to report a violation? DM <@UQNEXHW14> or fill out the <https://form.asana.com/?k=p7aM0fpd3G4JGETDL_nYXg&d=8587152060687|anonymous form here>.

There's a pre-built Developer permission set that has some common defaults, but the thing you want is the "Developer Tools Access" that's under in the permission set builder under Account > Settings Access <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/user-management/HubSpot-user-permissions-guide#settings-access>

Hey Tom, you should probably contact HubSpot support to chat about your domain connection.

That said, you have an MX record that is pointed to a subdomain and not `@`? i.e. <http://email.domain.com|email.domain.com> with value = <http://smtp.mailserver.com|smtp.mailserver.com>.

If that's the case, it sounds like you will need to choose a different subdomain to connect for HubSpot content.

Hi there,

We developed the application with the following scopes:
- <http://crm.objects.companies.read/|crm.objects.companies.read>
- crm.objects.companies.write
- <http://crm.objects.contacts.read/|crm.objects.contacts.read>
- crm.objects.contacts.write
- <http://crm.objects.owners.read/|crm.objects.owners.read>
- oauth

We will expand this list of scopes by adding the "<http://crm.lists.read/|crm.lists.read>" scope.
Do our current customers who have already installed our app need to reinstall it?
Thanks <@U05QGQ7LUVB> i currently have an app in the marketplace, is there an advantage to moving to UI extensions rather than keeping it the way it was?

As the ui-extensions are still in beta, I don't think so for the time being. But I also think that the ui-extensions will be the future and the old version will probably be sunsetted at some point. And the „advantage“ maybe could be that the ui-extensions makes your App Look like a integrated Feature of HubSpot… nur also depends on what your App Looks like :) 

Hope that helps you ;)

And if you wanna do let‘s have a look here:
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/beta-docs/guides/crm/public-apps/migrate-a-public-app-to-projects|https://developers.HubSpot.com/beta-docs/guides/crm/public-apps/migrate-a-public-app-to-projects>

Hi Nick,
Yes, your customers will need to reinstall the app if they want to use the new feature with the added scope. However, HubSpot has introduced an upgrade allowing you to set scopes as required, optional, or conditional.
If you don’t want your customers to reinstall the app, you can set the “crm.lists.read” scope as optional.
